subject: Re: [junit] Is stress test with junit possible?
msgSnippet: FYI, this is how you do it with TestNG: @Test(invocationCount = 1000, threadPoolSize = 20) public void webServiceTest() { ... } Maybe something to consider for
messageBody:
FYI, this is how you do it with TestNG:

@Test(invocationCount = 1000, threadPoolSize = 20)
public void webServiceTest() { ... }

Maybe something to consider for future versions of JUnit.

--
Cédric


On Thu, Apr 7, 2011 at 3:02 AM, uince1981 <uince1981@...> wrote:

> Hi, I'm new to java and Junit, I need to stress test a set of web services,
> now for each web service I have a test like this:
>
> @Test
> public void webServiceTest() {
> Integer firstParameter=0;
> Integer secondParameter=9;
> List<GeoArea> sampleList = kitDAO.myWebServiceToTest(firstParameter,
> secondParameter);
> Assert.assertNotNull(sampleList);
> Assert.assertTrue(sampleList.size() > 0);
> }
>
> Is there a way to call this test 100 time simultaneously with different
> parameters? I would create 100 thread, pass to them 100 different set of
> parameters and start the thread simultaneously. Do you think this is
> possible? How would you do it?
>
>
>
>
> ------------------------------------
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>


--
Cédric
